content:

Coincidentally, the Russian Collusion Hoax and many others were initiated to take Trump down. Trump wasn't just up against Obama and the Clintons, etc., he was up

Example of Rosa talking about elections: https://youtu.be/qSRADQ0S3d0?t=1501 permalink award report block reply hairless_ap3 1 points 3 days ago Was it some liberal white faggot? permalink award report block reply PorchLightOn 3 points 3 days ago When Brooks wrote the 2017 editorial, she was an armed reserve officer (and attorney) in the DC Metro Police. But before that she worked at the Pentagon as counsel to Under Sec of Defense for Policy Michelle Fluornoy. Now Brooks is a Georgetown law professor. From Grokipedia: https://grokipedia.com/page/Rosa_Brooks#rosa-brooks Rosa Brooks is an American law professor at Georgetown University, former senior official in the Obama administration's Department of Defense, reserve police officer, and author focused on national security, the militarization of policy, and policing.[1] She earned an A.B. in history and literature from Harvard University in 1991, an M.St. in social anthropology from Oxford University in 1993, and a J.D. from Yale Law School.[2] From 2009 to 2011, Brooks served as Counselor to Under Secretary of Defense for Policy Michèle Flournoy, advising on rule of law, humanitarian policy, and countering violent extremism. [1] In this role, she contributed to efforts addressing the expanding scope of U.S. military involvement in non-traditional security domains, a theme central to her 2016 book How Everything Became War and the Military Became Everything: Tales from the Pentagon.[3] Brooks later joined the Washington, D.C., Metropolitan Police Department as an armed reserve officer from 2016 to 2020, an experience that informed her 2021 book Tangled Up in Blue: Policing the American City, which critiques systemic issues in law enforcement while drawing from firsthand observation.[4] Her writings have included controversial proposals, such as a 2017 Foreign Policy article outlining mechanisms—including invocation of the 25th Amendment or military intervention—to remove President Donald Trump from office before 2020, prompting accusations of advocating undemocratic actions. [1] In this role, she contributed to efforts addressing the expanding scope of U.S. military involvement in non-traditional security domains, a theme central to her 2016 book How Everything Became War and the Military Became Everything: Tales from the Pentagon.[3] Brooks later joined the Washington, D.C., Metropolitan Police Department as an armed reserve officer from 2016 to 2020, an experience that informed her 2021 book Tangled Up in Blue: Policing the American City, which critiques systemic issues in law enforcement while drawing from firsthand observation.[4] Her writings have included controversial proposals, such as a 2017 Foreign Policy article outlining mechanisms—including invocation of the 25th Amendment or military intervention—to remove President Donald Trump from office before 2020, prompting accusations of advocating undemocratic actions.
